item.title: Enhancing my PC Performance
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

[quote=“Spades, post:14, topic:541501”][quote author=Travas link=topic=660370.msg4416203#msg4416203 date=1396040657]

You need one of these.
]http://cache.wists.com/thumbnails/b/bb/bbbd28a6c8d8627c3c611a6b2ab8790e-orig

What do you think he’s trying to build? A super computer…?

You know how big a Megabyte is right…?
[/quote]You do know what a joke is right…?

I work in I.T. and some people are actually have no idea, so you know I was making sure right…?[/quote]
…I am aware of how big a megabyte is.

item.title: Enhancing my PC Performance
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

I literally sold a gtx 640 today xD (for around $27 (£18). If you’re strapped for cash the gtx 750 ti is a really nice card (cause it overclocks really nicely). Low TDP (70w?) too which is pretty nice. If you can stretch a bit it might be worth considering a SSD for dem fast boot times (etc.).

It depends on your budget though ( if you have more cash to blow a gtx 760).

Read full topic

item.title: Enhancing my PC Performance
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

3.0 is always backwards compatible with older express graphic chips

you can always use x1 , x4, x8 chips in a x16 but not the other way around.

Go to videocardbenchmark website and fine a video card you like and buy it. It even has a ranking system so you can see what’s best.

Read full topic

item.title: Enhancing my PC Performance
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

I’d up the graphics card to either a GTX 670 or 760, Titanfall is pretty heavy on the GPU, my GTX 680 even struggles.

Read full topic

item.title: Enhancing my PC Performance
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

[quote=“Kozs, post:5, topic:541501”][quote author=Spades link=topic=660370.msg4415502#msg4415502 date=1395712560]
If you’re getting 80FPS on LoL that is pretty good. Anything over 60 is technically good.

You would need to get a better Graphics Card.
The one in there right now:
Graphics Coprocessor NVIDIA GeForce GT 640
Graphics Card Ram Size 2 GB

This is something like the card I have. I don’t know what board you have in your computer.

http://www.amazon.com/ASUS-GDDR5-DirectX-Graphics-GTX650TI-OC-2GD5/dp/B00BKFYJB0/ref=sr_1_2?s=electronics&ie=UTF8&qid=1395712428&sr=1-2&keywords=geforce+gtx+650+ti

And with games like LoL I get a solid 60FPS (I don’t allow it more than that)
MineCraft I get 120+ 200 at most times
RuneScape on high details I get a solid 60FPS.
[/quote]

Do all Graphic Cards work for my PC? Always confused on that[/quote]

If you can find out what Motherboard you have it would be easier. But most computers have a PCI Express x16 slot on it, which I am pretty sure yours has. It would be weird if it didn’t.

Read full topic
